items.content_html:
Adds how to write a good alt to the MDN writing guidelines.

Fixes #20948
items.title: Alt attribute: instructions

items.content_html: Fixes #21628, which points out that "vertical and horizontal" is confusing for borders. I couldn't find any other pages that should have a similar change - in particular these words make more sense for padding and margin - but if there are any more I'm happy to add them to this PR.
items.title: Use clearer language than vertical and horizontal

items.content_html:
Fixes #21574, fixes #21579.

Note that we have a project to do a proper update of the HTTP docs to include HTTP/3 (openwebdocs/project#43) but that's not garnered enough votes.

So this is a minor update, that tries to fix the most glaring problems reported in #21574 and #21579.
items.title: Minor updates to HTTP3/QUIC

items.content_html:
Changes in MathML rendering for <semantics> element in Fx 106:

By default, only the first child of the element is rendered while the others have their CSS display set to none.

Related issues

  • Parent issue: #20919
items.title: relnote(106) Add details for semantics MathML rendering changes

items.content_html:
Hello, just found this repo on learning resources on web development. I have added one more addition to the same. Got to know about scaler topics recently while I was looking for some resources to brush up on my Javascript skills. Topics were explained in a good manner, and I liked that we can learn from a free course out here so that we won't miss any topics. I hope this small contribution will help other learners as well.

Description

I have added a learning resource to learn various coding languages for free.

Motivation

I am a learner on the go and keep on searching for some good resources. Once a beginner in coding, I know how tough it is to find good-quality resources online. So helping out my juniors in my leisure time!

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Added a new resource

items.content_html:
The PR

  • adds missing sidebar to microformats page
  • replaces QuickLinksWithSubpages with ListSubpages. The quicklinks macro is adding a lot of uncollapsible stuff to the sidebars making them less reader friendly. With ListSubpages macro the sidebars are conscise.
  • fixes syntax errors in json code blocks
  • fixes typos
items.title: Web/HTML: Add/correct sidebars

items.content_html:
Description

This PR rewrites the PerformanceEventTiming interface page.

I think the list of exposed events needs to be grouped somehow. At least I don't like how it is just a plain list right now. It just looks very lost (see what's currently live: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceEventTiming). So, I made it an HTML table. Not sure if we generally want to avoid HTML tables, but I think this is somewhat tabular data and to my eyes it reads and scans a lot better this way. Open to do it differently, though.

I then added a bit of an intro text to the interface so people can understand what problem this API solves.
There is no constructor, but I always like to give people an idea how to get to the information an interface holds.
I also simplified the first example a bit to be very pure, so it can act as minimal boilerplate code for working with this interface. I think the second example also looks a bit packed, especially because since MDN uses a 3-column layout it doesn't have much space to breathe. I'm not sure what to do about it, though.

Finally, I updated the list of instance properties, one was missing and they are all read-only.

Motivation

The Performance API docs need to be improved! See openwebdocs/project#62.

Additional details

Will have follow-up PRs for the sub pages.

Related issues and pull requests

None.
items.title: Rewrite PerformanceEventTiming page

items.content_html:

Additional details

items.content_html:
This document expands on the HTMLMetaElement API docs and adds several pages for the associated properties with examples how to use them.

Notes:
I've omitted the browser-compat data for HTMLMetaElement.charset as this is missing, I can add in a follow-up to BCD first, then as content PR.

Related issues:

  • Parent task: #20928
items.title: 20928 Add details about HTMLMetaElement API usage with media

items.content_html:
Heroku no longer has free plans. MDN team evaluation seems to think Railway is a good option. This is docs update work.

Draft - needs read through by me prior to submission. Intent is Friday.

NOTE, might have to do a little more. I made the Db a separate project. You can do that, but better to make as a service in the same project. Might be worth just re-doing that bit.

Fixes #19987

Associated update to tutorial: mdn/django-locallibrary-tutorial#109
items.title: Django move from heroku to railway

items.content_html:
Description

Our style guide now recommends against adding words like "logs" or "outputs" in favor of more concise comments. This (quite large) PR fixes almost all instances in JS docs, making refactors where necessary.

However, where a single log statement is run multiple times, or where we are interested in the final complete log sequence, I've kept the "Logs" prefix at the start of the block.

Similarly, where it's unclear whether we are indicating the log a line produces or its return value, I've kept the "Logs" prefix.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Remove all log-indicating prefixes

items.content_html:
Adds another Markdownlint Search/Replace rule to prevent https://developer.mozilla.org links, since they should be absolute links instead.
Because the root Markdownfiles actually need the FQDN links, I swapped them to use Reference links so the regex doesn't catch them. Easier way would be a trailing Markdownlint disable comment, but those haven't been accepted in the past for other PRs, so this is the workaround
items.title: fix: don't allow FQDN links
